PipelineEnrichment.py -¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Code¶

PipelineEnrichment.buildGenomeGCSegmentation(infile, outfile)¶

segment the genome into windows according to G+C content.

PipelineEnrichment.buildAnnotatorGC(infile, outfile)¶

compute G+C regions.

PipelineEnrichment.buildIsochoresGC(infile, outfile)¶

compute isochores based on G+C content

PipelineEnrichment.buildWorkSpace(outfile, workspace)¶

write genomic workspace.

Available workspaces are:

genomic
the full genome
intronic
introns (requires annotator_regions to be set)
exonic
exonic (requires annotator_regions to be set)
intergenic
introns (requires annotator_regions to be set)
geneterritories
introns (requires annotator_geneterritories to be set)
mappable
mappable part of genome (requires annotator_mappability to be set )
alignable
only the alignable part of a genome (requires annotator_alignment to be set)

If gc_control is True, the chromosomes will be divided into isochores (requiers the paramater annotator_gc_workspace to be set).

PipelineEnrichment.buildAnnotatorAnnotations(tmpdir, outfile, annotations=None, bedfiles=None, gfffiles=None, gofile=None)¶

write annotations in annotator format.

PipelineEnrichment.buildGeneSetAnnotations(infiles, outfile, slice)¶

build annotations of all sets from database.

slice can be any of the slices in the annotation tables.

PipelineEnrichment.buildAnnotatorSlicedSegments(tmpdir, outfile, track, slice)¶

slice segments.

PipelineEnrichment.buildAnnotatorSegments(tmpdir, infile, outfile)¶

convert segments in bed format to annotator format from infile to outfile.

PipelineEnrichment.runAnnotator(tmpdir, outfile, tmpannotations, tmpsegments, tmpworkspaces, tmpsynonyms, options='')¶

run annotator.

PipelineEnrichment.genericImportAnnotator(infiles, outfile, table, workspace, slice, subset, fdr_method)¶

generic import of annotator results.

Assumes that the suffix of all infiles is the same.

PipelineEnrichment.importAnnotator(infiles, outfile, regex_id, table, fdr_method, with_slice=False)¶

generic import of annotator results.

If with-slice is true, the first id field is assumed to be a concatenation of track.slice.

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotatorGO(infile, outfile, gofile, workspace)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals and genomic segements having GO assignments.

worspace should be promotors or gene-territories

PipelineEnrichment.buildAnnotatorSegmentsROI(tmpdir, roi_class, outfile, overlap=None)¶

convert segments in bed format to annotator format from infile to outfile.

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotatorROIGO(roi_class, outfile, gofile, workspace, overlap=None)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals and genomic segements having GO assignments.

worspace should be promotors or gene-territories

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotatorArchitecture(infile, outfile, workspaces=('mappable', 'genomic'), **kwargs)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals and and other genomic features defined in the file PARAMS[“annotations”].

Annotator is run with the following parameters:

1 Segments: the interval track

2 Annotations:

1 genomic architecture (PARAMS[“annotation”]) 2 promotors (PARAMS[“promotors”])

3 Workspace: the full genome

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotator(infile, outfile, segments, annotations, workspaces=('mappable', 'genomic'), gc_control=True)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals and and other genomic features

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotatorTracks(infiles, outfile, **kwargs)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals and selected ucsc tracks

Annotator is run with the following parameters:

1 Segments: the interval track

2 Annotations:
1 ucsc encode features 2 disease intervals (regions of interest)

3 Workspace: the full genome

PipelineEnrichment.makeAnnotatorRegionsOfInterest(infiles, outfile, **kwargs)¶

check statistical overlap between intervals regions of interest.

Annotator is run with the following parameters:

1 Segments: the interval track

2 Annotations:
1 disease intervals (regions of interest)

3 Workspace: mappable part of gene territories
